subject: RE: [junit] Ant Log4j Classpath problem
msgSnippet: Sorry, I forgot to put the complete line where Ant invocation takes place. This is the correct one. ant -listener org.apache.tools.ant.listener.Log4jListener
messageBody:
Sorry,

I forgot to put the complete line where Ant invocation takes place. This is the correct one.

ant -listener org.apache.tools.ant.listener.Log4jListener some_target

Thanks.

> -----Mensaje original-----
> De: Roberto Juarez
> Enviado el: viernes, 13 de febrero de 2004 12:05
> Para: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Asunto: [junit] Ant Log4j Classpath problem
>
> Hello,
>
> I am having trouble with JUnit Ant Log4j integration.
>
> I am getting the following Log4j error messages on the console
>
> Buildfile: build.xml
> log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger (org.apache.tools.ant).
> log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.
>
> when launching Ant with the following batch file (irrelevant parts omitted).
>
> @echo off
> setlocal
>
> set LIBPATH=c:\develop\library
> set CLASSPATH=%LIBPATH%\junit-3.8.1.jar
> set CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%LIBPATH%\log4j-1.2.8.jar
> set CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%LIBPATH%\commons-logging-1.0.2.jar
>
> ant some_target
>
> If I remove junit from the classpath then log4j gets properly initialized. That is to say
>
> @echo off
> setlocal
>
> set LIBPATH=c:\develop\library
> set CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%LIBPATH%\log4j-1.2.8.jar
> set CLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%;%LIBPATH%\commons-logging-1.0.2.jar
>
> ant some_target
>
>
> Has anyone experimented this problem?
>
> Thanks.
>
> Roberto Juárez Maldonado
> Analista Programador
